page.title: 11The Local Police
page.content: Our local policeman works from the one main police station at Cromhall. He covers an area of 8,600 acres containing 4,000 people. He has been the local constable for 18 months. In that time the most serious crimes have been a robbery in Charfield Post Office, burglary in Cromhall, and vandalism. He has had to deal with some serious road accidents, but none involving serious injuries. He enjoys his job. He has previously worked in Bristol, covering an area of housing estates, and at Almondsbury in the motorway patrol police. He sees his job at Charfield as helping people, as when he takes children for cycling proficiency, and preventing crime. He works an eight hour shift including three out of four weekends, totalling 40 hours per week.
